suppress.notes: The CVE-2018-1258 occurs from spring security libraries, despite the latest versions are used. This is confirmed as false positive and hence it is suppressed (https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/2952). see (https://pivotal.io/security/cve-2018-1258)

These CVE's are coming from Dhowden tag library and it impacts only MP3/MP4/OGG/FLAC metadata parsing library. Also it is declared as false positive in (https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/3043)
False positive reported for Oauth2-oidc-sdk at (https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/1658) and (https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/2866)
This CVE appears in the latest version of wiremock, WireMock 2.27.2 JRE 8 embeds jquery-3.4.1.min.js. see(https://github.com/tomakehurst/wiremock/issues/1417)
This CVE appears in the latest version of jakarta

A vulnerability in all versions of Nim-lang allows unauthenticated attackers to write files to arbitrary directories via a crafted zip file with dot-slash characters included in the name of the crafted file
A vulnerability in all versions of adal4j, this library is an internal dependency in azure libraries. Hence this is suppressed

In logback version 1.2.7 and prior versions, an attacker with the required privileges to edit configurations files could craft a malicious configuration allowing to execute arbitrary code loaded from LDAP servers.
Need to resolve Liquibase issue before updating the library
jackson-databind before 2.13.0 allows a Java StackOverflow exception and denial of service via a large depth of nested objects.
Need to resolve Liquibase issue before updating the library

A Spring MVC or Spring WebFlux application running on JDK 9+ may be vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) via data binding. The specific exploit requires the application to run on Tomcat as a WAR deployment. If the application is deployed as a Spring Boot executable jar, i.e. the default, it is not vulnerable to the exploit. However, the nature of the vulnerability is more general, and there may be other ways to exploit it.
